original_solution_mapping.L1: The cypress trees will earn Gloria 20 trees * $100/tree = $<<20*100=2000>>2000
original_solution_mapping.L2: From the sale of the cypress trees, Gloria will also make 600 trees * $200/tree = $<<600*200=120000>>120000
original_solution_mapping.L3: Finally, the maple trees will bring in 24 trees * $300/tree = $<<24*300=7200>>7200
original_solution_mapping.L4: Combining all the amounts will give Gloria a total of $150 + $2000 + $120000 + $7200 = $<<150+2000+120000+7200=129350>>129350
original_solution_mapping.L5: Subtracting the cost of the mountain cabin from the total will leave Gloria with a balance of $129350 - $129000 = $<<129350-129000=350>>350

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2871.
    Returns: the amount of money Gloria will have left after paying for the cabin.
    """
    # L1
    num_cypress_trees = 20 # 20 cypress trees
    price_per_cypress = 100 # $100 for each cypress tree
    cypress_earnings = num_cypress_trees * price_per_cypress

    # L2
    num_pine_trees = 600 # 600 pine trees
    price_per_pine = 200 # $200 per pine tree
    pine_earnings = num_pine_trees * price_per_pine

    # L3
    num_maple_trees = 24 # 24 maple trees
    price_per_maple = 300 # $300 for a maple tree
    maple_earnings = num_maple_trees * price_per_maple

    # L4
    cash_on_hand = 150 # $150 in cash
    total_funds = cash_on_hand + cypress_earnings + pine_earnings + maple_earnings

    # L5
    cabin_cost = 129000 # $129,000 mountain cabin
    remaining_balance = total_funds - cabin_cost

    # FA
    answer = remaining_balance
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: The cypress trees will earn Gloria {num_cypress_trees} trees * ${price_per_cypress}/tree = $<<{num_cypress_trees}*{price_per_cypress}={cypress_earnings}>>{cypress_earnings}
From the sale of the cypress trees, Gloria will also make {num_pine_trees} trees * ${price_per_pine}/tree = $<<{num_pine_trees}*{price_per_pine}={pine_earnings}>>{pine_earnings}
Finally, the maple trees will bring in {num_maple_trees} trees * ${price_per_maple}/tree = $<<{num_maple_trees}*{price_per_maple}={maple_earnings}>>{maple_earnings}

Combining all the amounts will give Gloria a total of ${cash_on_hand} + ${cypress_earnings} + ${pine_earnings} + ${maple_earnings} = $<<{cash_on_hand}+{cypress_earnings}+{pine_earnings}+{maple_earnings}={total_funds}>>{total_funds}
Subtracting the cost of the mountain cabin from the total will leave Gloria with a balance of ${total_funds} - ${cabin_cost} = $<<{total_funds}-{cabin_cost}={remaining_balance}>>{remaining_balance}
